html:
Apr 23 - Telecoms and mobile money services group Airtel Africa has signed a US$500m loan with a group of relationship banks.

The four-year facility comprises a revolving credit facility and term loans.

Bank of America, BNP Paribas, Citibank, HSBC, JP Morgan, Standard Chartered and two Indian relationship banks, Axis Bank and Kotak Mahindra Bank, provided the loan.

It will be used to partially refinance the group’s €750m bond due on May 20. The balance of the bond will be repaid with existing cash to reduce gross debt and associated interest costs.

UK-headquartered Airtel Africa is a multinational company operating in 14 countries primarily in East, Central and West Africa.

(Editing by Chris Mangham)
